meanings.definition: To use less of something than is necessary or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: She was underusing her talents by not practicing enough.
meanings.sent2: The company was underusing its resources by not investing in new technology.
meanings.sent3: He realized he was underusing his brainpower when he struggled with the simple puzzle.
meanings.sent4: By underusing her creativity, she was missing out on great opportunities.
meanings.sent5: Underusing his skills was like having a toolbox full of tools but only using a hammer.

meanings.definition: To not make full use of something.
meanings.sent1: The students were underusing the library by not exploring all the available resources.
meanings.sent2: The chef was underusing the fresh herbs by only using salt and pepper for seasoning.
meanings.sent3: The car was underusing its potential by always driving at a slow speed.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was underusing her wardrobe by always wearing the same outfit.
meanings.sent5: Underusing the opportunities presented to you is like leaving money on the table.
